sentences.en: He should exude ruggedness and power , living up to his nickname, the " Diehard. "
sentences.cn: 他有时也蛮横而且力气大,所以为自己赢得了 “ 顽固分子 ” 的雅号.

sentences.en: He was much annoyed at my remark and called me a diehard.
sentences.cn: 他听了非常不高兴,竟骂我思想顽固.

sentences.en: I heard we have a diehard audience member.
sentences.cn: 听说咱们又有一位铁杆观众.

sentences.en: It's no good asking him to join the union; he's a real diehard.
sentences.cn: 要他参加工会不太好, 他是个真正的死硬分子.

sentences.en: John is a diehard conservative and is completely against abortion.
sentences.cn: 约翰是个顽固的保守主义者,坚决反对堕胎.

sentences.en: Mr Koizumi is no diehard imperialist.
sentences.cn: 小泉不是顽固的帝国主义分子.

sentences.en: Though there are always predictable throngs of diehard Beatles fans and classic?
sentences.cn: 尽管有大批可预见的披头士发烧友和古典摇滚乐迷抢购这些最新包装的音乐作品,但这一回主要的购买者却是12岁甚至更小的孩子.

words.tran_cn: 顽固分子；死不屈从者；倔强的人

trans.tran_en: someone who opposes change and refuses to accept new ideas
